events.message: The candidate submitted their application for the software engineer position, highlighting relevant skills and experience in software development.
The recruitment team reviewed the application and categorized it under the engineering department due to the focus on software and development expertise.
A recruiter was assigned to the candidate's profile to coordinate further screening and interview scheduling processes.
The recruiter conducted an initial phone screening to assess the candidate’s technical background and communication skills.
The candidate responded promptly, expressing interest in moving forward with the technical interview stage.
The technical interview was scheduled for the candidate with the engineering team to evaluate coding skills and problem-solving abilities.
The candidate successfully completed the technical interview, demonstrating strong software development knowledge and practical skills.
An HR interview was scheduled to discuss the candidate’s fit with company culture and to review compensation expectations.
The candidate completed the HR interview, showing alignment with the company’s values and enthusiasm about joining the team.
An offer was formally proposed to the candidate, outlining salary, benefits, and other employment terms.
The candidate provided positive feedback regarding the offer, expressing excitement about the opportunity.
The candidate officially accepted the offer, confirming their intent to join the engineering team.
Onboarding activities began to integrate the new hire into the company, including orientation and setup of necessary development tools.
The recruitment process was successfully closed with the candidate fully onboarded and ready to start their role as software engineer.
